    • isValidPortableFileName

      public static boolean isValidPortableFileName(String strFileName)
      Returns true if the given name is a valid portable file name.

      Obviously we can't really make this determination in any absolute sense if we support an open ended set of operating/file systems. So we try to take a common denominator approach and permit names that contain characters in the domain defined by the intersection of conventional characters for "common" file systems.

      For details regarding to FAT, NTFS, HPFS file systems see: http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;EN-US;100108

      Invalid chars for: FAT32: "/\[]:;|=, NTFS: ?"/\invalid input: '<'>*|: HPFS: /\ AIX: /\ UNIX: /\ note some characters have special meaning, but are legal e.g., '~'

      Combined: "/\[]:;|=,?invalid input: '<'>*

      Note some older file systems are more strict, but for usability purposes we opt for more flexible naming conventions.

    • makeValidPortableFileName

    • findFile

      public static File findFile(String startDir, String fileName)
      Finds a file in a directory tree. If the file exists more than once, the first one found is returned. Since Windows is case-insensitive, this search will also be case-insenstive.
      Returns:
      Found file, else null.

    • eachFileInTree

      public static void eachFileInTree(File dir, FileBlock block, FileFilter dirPredicate)
      Evaluates the given block on every File in the tree. If dirPredicate is specified, it can be used to filter which directories are traversed; if it's left null, all subdirectories will be traversed.
      Parameters:
      dir -
      block -
      dirPredicate -

    • createTempDir

      public static File createTempDir(String name) throws IOException
      This will create a directory under .deletable, and will be purge by the PurgeDeletableFile batch processes when it has been aged out.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the directory
      Returns:
      the created deletable directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if it fails to create the directory

    • createTempDir

      public static File createTempDir(File systemTmpDir, String newTmpDirName)
      This will create a temp directory, if the directory is the system tmp directory or null it will create the directory under .deletable, and will be purge by the PurgeDeletableFile batch processes when it has been aged out. Otherwise it will be marked as delete on exit, and may leak memory.
      Parameters:
      systemTmpDir - if null will use getSystemTmpDir
      newTmpDirName - the name to create
      Returns:
      the created directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if it fails to create the directory

    • getDeletableTempFileDirectory

      public static File getDeletableTempFileDirectory()
      Will create a directory for temp files that can be deleted on startup, and will be aged by the PurgeDeletableFiles
      Returns:
      the directory

    • clearLocalCleanupTimer

      public static void clearLocalCleanupTimer()
      Will clear the temporary directory and get rid of the timer. Should normally only be called when the server is leaving daemons.

      public static File createDeletableTempFile(String prefix, String suffix) throws IOException
      Will create a temp file in the deletable directory
      Parameters:
      prefix - the file name prefix
      suffix - the file name suffix, typically "." and extension
      Returns:
      the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if it can not create the temp file

    • concatDirectories

      public static String concatDirectories(String... directories)
      Return a string of the given directories concatenated with File.separator characters seperating them. This is a safer way to write out paths as opposed to using '\\' and '/' characters.
      Returns:
      a path string, or the empty string there are no directories to contacenate.

    • readBytes

      public static void readBytes(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedInputStream> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in read mode, and passes a BufferedInputStream to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer a file-based input stream, as reading individual bytes from such a stream can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw FileInputStream should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readChars

      public static void readChars(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedReader> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in read mode, and passes a BufferedReader to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer an InputStreamReader, as reading individual chars from such a reader can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw InputStreamReader should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readLines

      public static void readLines(File f, LineBlock block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in read mode, and passes each line to the given block. Lines are generated using BufferedReader.readLine(), so any end-of-line characters, as defined by that method, will not be included in the line.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readLines

      public static void readLines(IFile f, LineBlock block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in read mode, and passes each line to the given block. Lines are generated using BufferedReader.readLine(), so any end-of-line characters, as defined by that method, will not be included in the line.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeBytes

      public static void writeBytes(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedOutputStream> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in write mode, and passes a BufferedOutputStream to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer a file-based output stream, as writing individual bytes to such a stream can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw FileOutputStream should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeChars

      public static void writeChars(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedWriter> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in write mode, and passes a BufferedWriter to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer an OutputStreamWriter, as writing individual chars from such a writer can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw OutputStreamWriter should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeLines

      public static void writeLines(File f, Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in write mode, and writes each line returned by the given Iterable. End-of-line characters are written after each line, as defined by BufferedWriter.newLine().
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appendBytes

      public static void appendBytes(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedOutputStream> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in append mode, and passes a BufferedOutputStream to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer a file-based output stream, as writing individual bytes to such a stream can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw FileOutputStream should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appendChars

      public static void appendChars(File f, StreamBlock<? super BufferedWriter> block) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in append mode, and passes a BufferedWriter to the given block. Typically it's best to buffer an OutputStreamWriter, as writing individual chars from such a writer can be inefficient. Callers that want to work with a raw OutputStreamWriter should use IOUtil.withOpenStream(gw.pl.io.StreamFactory, gw.pl.io.StreamBlock) directly.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appendLines

      public static void appendLines(File f, Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines) throws IOException
      Opens the given file in append mode, and appends each line returned by the given Iterable. End-of-line characters are written after each line, as defined by BufferedWriter.newLine().
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getRelativeSrcDir

      public static String getRelativeSrcDir(String product, String type)
      Gives a source directory string relative to the devhome (commons,src) => "platform/commons/src" (platform,src) => "platform/pl/src" (platform,gunit) => "platform/pl-gunit/src" (px,src) => "app-px/px/src" (px,gunit) => "app-px/px-gunit/src"
      Parameters:
      product - a two-letter app code
      type - gunit, test, or anything else
      Returns:

    • resolveRelativePath

      public static File resolveRelativePath(File parent, String relativePath)
      Tries its darnedest to build a canonical file with a parent directory and a relative path.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent directory to base the relative path
      relativePath - the path relative to the parent directory
      Returns:
      new File(parent, relativePath).getCanonicalFile() or simply new File(parent, relativePath) if that doesn't work out for some reason

    • getRelativePath

      public static String getRelativePath(File baseDir, File file)
      Produces a relative path string that describes one directory's location relative to another.
      Parameters:
      baseDir - the base directory from which to begin calculating the relative path
      file - the file to be represented by the relative path
      Returns:
      the relative path from baseDir to file

    • fileUnderParent

      public static String fileUnderParent(File parent, File file)
      Returns true if file is under parent
      Parameters:
      parent - a directory
      file - a file
      Returns:
      a string representing the relative path from the parent to the file, or null if the file is not under the parent

      public static File getBestAvailableFile(File fileToFix)

    • encodeFileName

      public static String encodeFileName(String fileName)
      Encodes the given file name such that it is safe to serve in an HTTP request.
      Parameters:
      fileName - file name with possible multi-byte unicode characters
